gov.usgs.traveltime

Class TtStatLinFit

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.traveltime.TtStatLinFit

  • public class TtStatLinFit
extends java.lang.Object
    Acquire the travel-time statistics data in one degree bins, do the linear fits between the break flags, and release the raw statistics data.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected TtStatLinFit(TtStat ttStat)
      Set up the 1 degree arrays.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Add statistics for one 1 degree distance bin.
      protected double[] do1Fit(int start, int end, double minDelta, double[] value)
      Do the linear fit for one segment of one statistics variable.
      protected void doFits(java.util.ArrayList<TtStatSeg> interp, double[] value, boolean[] brk)
      Do the linear fits for all segments of one statistics variable.
      protected void dumpStats()
      Print the travel-time statistics.
      protected void fitAll()
      Do the linear fits for all statistics variables.
      protected void fixEnds(java.util.ArrayList<TtStatSeg> interp)
      Successive linear fits don't quite connect with each other at exactly the break point distances.

      • TtStatLinFit

        protected TtStatLinFit(TtStat ttStat)
        Set up the 1 degree arrays.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        protected void add(int delta,
                   double res,
                   boolean resBrk,
                   double spd,
                   boolean spdBrk,
                   double obs,
                   boolean obsBrk)
        Add statistics for one 1 degree distance bin.
        Parameters:
        delta - Distance in degrees at the bin center
        res - Travel-time residual bias in seconds
        resBrk - Break the interpolation at this bin if true
        spd - Robust estimate of the scatter of travel-time residuals
        spdBrk - Break the interpolation at this bin if true
        obs - Number of times this phase was observed in the defining study
        obsBrk - Break the interpolation at this bin if true

      • fitAll

        protected void fitAll()
        Do the linear fits for all statistics variables.

      • doFits

        protected void doFits(java.util.ArrayList<TtStatSeg> interp,
                      double[] value,
                      boolean[] brk)
        Do the linear fits for all segments of one statistics variable.
        Parameters:
        interp - The ArrayList where the fits will be stored
        value - Array of parameter values
        brk - Array of break point flags

      • do1Fit

        protected double[] do1Fit(int start,
                          int end,
                          double minDelta,
                          double[] value)
        Do the linear fit for one segment of one statistics variable.
        Parameters:
        start - Array index of the start of the segment
        end - Array index of the end of the segment
        minDelta - Minimum distance where the phase is observed in degrees
        value - Raw statistics data to be fit
        Returns:
        An array containing the fit slope and offset

      • fixEnds

        protected void fixEnds(java.util.ArrayList<TtStatSeg> interp)
        Successive linear fits don't quite connect with each other at exactly the break point distances. Compute the actual cross- over distances and apply them to the end of one segment and the start of the next.
        Parameters:
        interp - ArrayList of linear fit segments for one parameter

      • dumpStats

        protected void dumpStats()
        Print the travel-time statistics.
